content.user_title: Design frontend interfaces with creative excellence
content.value_statement: Generic AI-generated frontend code often looks generic and unimpressive. This skill guides creation of unique, production-quality web interfaces with bold design choices and careful attention to visual details.
actual_capabilities: Create unique web interfaces with bold, intentional design choices
Apply design thinking process (purpose, style, constraints, differentiation)
Use advanced CSS techniques (gradients, animations, glassmorphism, noise textures)
Implement responsive layouts with Grid and Flexbox
Design animations using CSS and animation libraries (Framer Motion, Anime.js)
Avoid generic AI aesthetics through distinctive typography and color schemes
limitations: Does not generate actual code files - provides design guidance only
Requires user to implement designs in their preferred framework
Does not access local files or project context
Design quality depends on following provided principles and guidelines

use_cases.title: Build polished web components
use_cases.description: Create React, Vue, or HTML/CSS components with distinctive visual design and smooth animations.

use_cases.title: Design landing pages
use_cases.description: Craft unique landing pages with bold typography, creative layouts, and engaging visual effects.

use_cases.title: Create UI systems
use_cases.description: Build design systems with consistent aesthetics, custom design tokens, and reusable component patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Basic component request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a [component type] with a [style direction] aesthetic. Include [key features]. Focus on typography, spacing, and one subtle animation effect.

prompt_templates.title: Landing page design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a landing page for [product type] with [specific aesthetic]. Include hero section, feature grid, and CTA. Use unique typography and avoid generic layouts.

prompt_templates.title: React component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a React component using Framer Motion with [animation style]. Include [interactions] and use [color scheme]. Prioritize accessibility.

prompt_templates.title: Design system
prompt_templates.prompt: Define a design system for [project type] with [aesthetic direction]. Include color palette, typography scale, spacing system, and 3 component examples with CSS variables.

output_examples.input: Create a pricing card component with a premium aesthetic
output: Design thinking: Premium luxury with elegant typography (Cormorant Garamond), gold accents, subtle depth
Implementation: Glassmorphism effect with backdrop blur, smooth hover lift, refined typography hierarchy
Unique touch: Custom cursor, subtle noise texture overlay, carefully calibrated gold accent (#C9A962)

best_practices: Choose distinctive fonts (avoid Inter, Roboto, Arial) and create intentional typography pairings
Apply consistent CSS variables for colors and spacing to maintain design coherence
Test designs across screen sizes and verify accessibility (contrast ratios, ARIA labels, keyboard navigation)
anti_patterns: Using generic fonts and white background with purple gradient - creates recognizable AI aesthetic
Centering all elements in uniform grids - produces boring, forgettable layouts
Following safe design choices instead of making bold, intentional decisions

faq.question: Which frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: React, Vue, and vanilla HTML/CSS. Guidelines include Framer Motion for React and general CSS approaches.

faq.question: What design aesthetics are covered?
faq.answer: Minimalism, brutalist, retro-futurism, organic, luxury, playful, editorial, neomorphism, glassmorphism, and more.

faq.question: Can I use this with Tailwind CSS?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill recommends customizing Tailwind config rather than using default values to maintain unique aesthetics.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution, file access, or network calls. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: How is this different from standard code generation?
faq.answer: Focuses on intentional design decisions, unique aesthetics, and avoiding generic patterns common in AI-generated code.

faq.question: What animation libraries are recommended?
faq.answer: Framer Motion (React), Anime.js, and GreenSock for complex animations. CSS animations preferred for simple effects.
